conflicts.name: squashfs~gzip default_compression=gzip
conflicts.description: squashfs: Cannot set default compression to missing algorithm

conflicts.name: squashfs~lz4 default_compression=lz4
conflicts.description: squashfs: Cannot set default compression to missing algorithm

conflicts.name: squashfs~lzo default_compression=lzo
conflicts.description: squashfs: Cannot set default compression to missing algorithm

conflicts.name: squashfs~xz default_compression=xz
conflicts.description: squashfs: Cannot set default compression to missing algorithm

conflicts.name: squashfs~zstd default_compression=zstd
conflicts.description: squashfs: Cannot set default compression to missing algorithm

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

dependencies.name: gmake
dependencies.description:
GNU Make is a tool which controls the generation of executables and
other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

dependencies.name: zlib-api
dependencies.description:
A free, general-purpose, legally unencumbered lossless data-compression
library.

dependencies.name: lz4
dependencies.description:
LZ4 is lossless compression algorithm, providing compression speed at
400 MB/s per core, scalable with multi-cores CPU. It also features an
extremely fast decoder, with speed in multiple GB/s per core, typically
reaching RAM speed limits on multi-core systems.

dependencies.name: xz
dependencies.description:
XZ Utils is free general-purpose data compression software with high
compression ratio. XZ Utils were written for POSIX-like systems, but
also work on some not-so-POSIX systems. XZ Utils are the successor to
LZMA Utils.

dependencies.name: zstd
dependencies.description:
Zstandard, or zstd as short version, is a fast lossless compression
algorithm, targeting real-time compression scenarios at zlib-level and
better compression ratios.

dependent_to.name: apptainer
dependent_to.description:
Apptainer is an open source container platform designed to be simple,
fast, and secure. Many container platforms are available, but Apptainer
is designed for ease-of-use on shared systems and in high performance
computing (HPC) environments. Needs post-install chmod/chown steps to
enable full functionality. See package definition or `spack-build-
out.txt` build log for details, e.g.: tail -15 $(spack location -i
apptainer)/.spack/spack-build-out.txt

dependent_to.name: singularity
dependent_to.description:
Singularity is a container technology focused on building portable
encapsulated environments to support "Mobility of Compute" For older
versions of Singularity (pre 3.0) you should use singularity-legacy,
which has a different install base (Autotools). Needs post-install
chmod/chown steps to enable full functionality. See package definition
or `spack-build-out.txt` build log for details, e.g. tail -15 $(spack
location -i singularity)/.spack/spack-build-out.txt

dependent_to.name: sarus
dependent_to.description: Sarus is an OCI-compliant container engine for HPC systems.

dependent_to.name: charliecloud
dependent_to.description: Lightweight user-defined software stacks for HPC.

dependent_to.name: singularityce
dependent_to.description:
Singularity is a container technology focused on building portable
encapsulated environments to support "Mobility of Compute" For older
versions of Singularity (pre 3.0) you should use singularity-legacy,
which has a different install base (Autotools). Needs post-install
chmod/chown steps to enable full functionality. See package definition
or `spack-build-out.txt` build log for details, e.g. tail -15 $(spack
location -i singularityce)/.spack/spack-build-out.txt
